block.p: PARAGON TRADE BRANDS INC., Norcross, Ga., said it would sell its feminine-hygiene business to focus on making diapers. Paragon said it was in talks with ''several interested purchasers.''
KEMET CORP., Greenville, S.C., which makes specialized components that regulate current flow, said it would buy back up to four million shares of its common stock.

PARK ELECTROCHEMICAL CORP., Lake Success, N.Y., a seller of chemicals and other materials to the semiconductor industry, said it planned to expand the capacity of its Neltec unit's plant in Tempe, Ariz., by more than 50 percent.

PRINCETON REVIEW INC., New York, which offers classes to prepare students for standardized admissions tests for college, said it planned an initial public offering that would raise as much as $65 million.
